title: [Large-Scale] Business Model Innovation (BMI) and Executive Roles: Evidence-Based Learning Through Empirical Research

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational business administration theories and introductory statistics knowledge
context.additional_context: A collaborative learning space enabling structure equation modeling (SEM) tool utilization in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of managerial competencies (managerial skills, networks, entrepreneurial mindset) on BMI through structural equation modeling (SEM)
Learners can interpret the mediating effects of explorative/exploitative learning on BMI
Learners can propose strategies for developing managerial competencies to drive organizational innovation based on empirical research data

resources: BMI Case Dataset of a Multinational Corporation in India

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
